Description:
ResponsibilitiesComplex Geometry Design: Utilize your in-depth knowledge of complex geometry principles to develop innovative and striking architectural designs. Employ advanced computational design techniques through tools like Grasshopper3D to achieve unique forms and optimize performance.
Project Planning: Engage in the conceptualization, planning, and development of projects with a focus on complex geometries. Participate in design charrettes and brainstorming sessions to provide valuable insights and contribute to the overall design strategy.
Software Expertise: Demonstrate proficiency in Revit, Grasshopper3D, and Rhino to model, analyze, and refine complex architectural geometries. Develop workflows to enhance the efficiency and precision of the design process.
Collaboration: Work closely and coordinate with multidisciplinary teams, including architects, engineers, and consultants, to ensure seamless coordination and integration of complex project elements within the overall design.
Research and Development: Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices related to large-scale project design. Implement innovative design solutions to address project challenges.
Quality Control: Ensure that all architectural designs meet high standards of quality, aesthetics, functionality, and sustainability. Conduct thorough reviews and analyses to identify and resolve design issues.
Quality Assurance: Ensure that all architectural designs meet the highest standards of quality, aesthetics, functionality, and compliance with local building codes and regulations.
Team Interaction: Engage with the team and consultants to understand the vision, objectives, and requirements, and effectively communicate complex design concepts in a clear and concise manner.
BIM Implementation: Spearhead the implementation of Building Information Modeling (BIM) processes within the team for large-scale projects, driving efficiency and collaboration.Rewards & BenfitsA competitive salary
